sense.def:
To rush somewhere
pomeni odpraviti se nekam z vso naglico.

seg.quote: When they saw us, they rushed forward.
The water rushed in over the top of his boots.
There was a little rush of air.

sense.def:
To rush to do something
pomeni nekaj narediti brez odlašanja, ker smo zelo zavzeti, da bi tisto naredili.

seg.quote: People were rushing to buy the newspaper.
Her friends rushed to her aid.

sense.def:
To rush something
pomeni nekaj na hitro narediti.

seg.quote: It'll be a bit of a rushed job, I'm afraid.

sense.def:
To rush someone or something to a place
pomeni, da nekoga ali nekaj hitro nekam odpeljemo.

seg.quote: Barnett was rushed to hospital with a broken back.

sense.def:
To rush someone into doing something
pomeni pripraviti nekoga do tega, da nekaj naredi na hitro, ne da bi imel dovolj časa, da bi o tistem prej razmislil.

seg.quote: Do not be rushed into parting with goods before taking legal advice.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
no rush to do something
povemo, da ni nikakršne potrebe, da bi nekaj naredili hitro.

seg.quote: There is no rush to fill the vacancy.

sense.def:
A rush for something
ali
a rush to do something
pomeni, da se naenkrat poveča število poskusov, da bi nekaj dobili ali dosegli.

seg.quote: There had been a rush for tickets.

sense.def:
To experience a rush of a feeling
pomeni naenkrat zelo močno občutiti določeno čustvo.

seg.quote: She felt a rush of pity for the boy.

sense.def:
Rushes
so rastline, ki rastejo ob vodi in imajo visoka tanka stebla.

To rush into a situation
pomeni zaplesti se v kaj, ne da bi o tistem prej temeljito premislili.
